isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - AERODYNAMIC PANELS - ROOF AIR DEFLECTOR - PRO SLEEPER® AERODYNAMIC DEFLECTOR

svcsubproc.title: Description
svcsubproc.para: In July, 1994, International introduced a flat top and high roof PRO SLEEPER®. The roof deflector assembly for each tractor will be shipped to the dealer directly from the deflector manufacturer unpainted. It will be the dealer's responsibility to paint and install the roof deflector assembly.

step1.para: Prepare the outer surface of the air deflector and air deflector extenders for painting as explained in GROUP 16 - PAINTING in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

Paint the air deflector and side deflectors the finish color before installation. The inside of the air deflector and back side of the air deflector extenders and the antenna mount (if included) do not require a class 1 finish.
Also paint the 8 star bolt assemblies, and 2 "L" brackets the finish color.

Completely cover the roof of the cab with blankets or tarps to protect the roof from being damaged during the installation procedure. Also cover the air horn(s). Care must be taken not to damage the air horn(s) during the air deflector installation.

Remove the cab drag link airshield brace from the air deflector middle and rear mounting brackets on both sides of the vehicle ( Figure 8). Reinstall the bolt that secures the middle mount to the cab roof. Tighten finger tight.
Position the air deflector on the air deflector front mounting bracket tabs ( Figure 9), then slide the air deflector back against the air deflector rear mounting brackets ( Figure 9).
Reinstall the cab drag link airshield brace between the middle mounting bracket and the air deflector ( Figure 8). Install and tighten the bolt on the middle mount finger tight.

Install two 3/8"x 1-1/2" hex hd. bolts and 3/8" flat washers through the two holes in the air deflector rear mounting bracket, through the rear of the air deflector and cab drag link airshield brace on both sides of the vehicle ( Figure 9). Install a 3/8" nylon insert locknut and 3/8" flat washer on each bolt. Tighten the locknuts until they are snug and the air deflector is against both air deflector rear mounting brackets.

With the air deflector resting on the front mounting tabs, measure the clearance between the front of the air deflector and the cab roof. The clearance across the front should be 3/4 of an inch ( Figure 10). If it's not close to 3/4 of an inch, block the front of the air deflector up to obtain the correct clearance. Be sure the measurement is the same across the front of the air deflector ( Figure 10).

note.para: If you plan on installing more than one set of PRO SLEEPER air deflector assemblies, it is recommended that metal templates be made from the drawings Figure 11.

step1.para: Place the drilling templates in position on the tabs of the air deflector front mounting bracket as illustrated in Figure 12. Be sure the slot in the template is resting on the tab ( Figure 12). Tape the template in this position.

figure.caption: Figure 12. Slot In Template Resting On Tab

step1.para: Drill a 1/8 inch pilot hole through the air deflector in both positions indicated on the template.
Remove the template and drill a 13/32 inch hole through the air deflector in both pilot hole locations.
Care should be taken not to damage the threads in the air deflector front mounting bracket when the drill passes through the fiberglass material of the air deflector.
Install a 3/8" x 1-3/4" Star Drive bolt assembly in both holes and tighten finger tight ( Figure 13). If the bolts are difficult to install, run a 3/8"-16 tap in the holes to clean up the threads.

figure.caption: Figure 13. Air Deflector Middle Mounting Brackets

step1.para: Repeat steps 9 through 12 on the opposite side of the vehicle.

Be sure the middle mounting bracket is against the inside of the air deflector ( Figure 13) and use the 1/8" pilot drill to drill a hole (from the inside) at each bolt hole location in both air deflector middle mounting brackets ( Figure 13).
From the outside of the air deflector, drill a 13/32" hole at each 1/8" pilot hole location.
Install, from the outside, a 3/8" x 1-3/4" Star Drive bolt assembly through the air deflector and mounting bracket. Secure with a flat washer and 3/8"-16 nylon insert locknut ( Figure 13).
Tighten all air deflector front and middle Star Drive bolts assemblies and the middle mounting bracket mounting bolt to 31 ft-lbs. (42 N•m).
Remove the two 3/8 inch bolts from the rear mounting bracket, through the rear of the air deflector ( Figure 14).

Position the right air deflector extender to the right rear of the roof air deflector so the bottom two holes in the side deflector line up with the two lower holes in the air deflector rear mounting bracket ( Figure 14).
Reinstall the two 3/8 inch bolts, flat washers and nuts removed in step one in these holes ( Figure 14).

Position the side deflector so it is flush with the side and top of the roof air deflector ( Figure 15). Hold in place with a "C" clamp ( Figure 14 and Figure 15). Tighten the two lower nuts to 31 ft-lbs. (42 N•m).

figure.caption: Figure 15. Side Deflector Flush With Roof Air Deflector

step1.para: Use the holes in the mounting flange of the air deflector extender as a template and drill a 11/32 inch hole through the roof air deflector at each hole location ( Figure 15).

From the air deflector extender side, install a 5/16" x 1" hex hd. bolt and 5/16 inch flat washer through each hole. Install a 5/16 inch flat washer and nylon insert lock nut on each bolt ( Figure 15). Tighten to 18 ft-lbs. (24 N•m). Remove the "C" clamp.
Repeat steps 1 through 6 on the left air deflector extender.

Position the "L" bracket on the inside of the lower side air deflector and up against the bottom of the air deflector extender as illustrated in Figure 16 Secure in place with two 5/16"-18 x 1" hex hd. bolts and 5/16" lock washers. Tighten hand tight.

Use the hole on the side of the "L" bracket that is against the bottom of the upper air deflector extender as a guide to drill a 11/32" hole through the bottom of the upper side mounted air deflector ( Figure 16). Secure the "L" bracket to the upper air deflector extender with a 5/16"-18 x 1" hex hd. bolt, flat washer, lock washer and hex nut through this hole with the head of the bolt and a flat washer against the upper air deflector extender ( Figure 16). Tighten the fasteners to 18 ft-lbs. (24 N•m).
Remove the 7th and 8th bolts (from the bottom going up) that secure the air deflector extender to the roof air deflector and discard.
Place antenna mount against side deflector and align with the holes of the bolts removed in step one ( Figure 17).

Install a 5/16" x 1-1/4" hex hd. bolt and 5/16 inch flat washer through these holes into the roof air deflector. Install a 5/16 inch flat washer and locknut on each bolt ( Figure 17). Tighten to 18 ft-lbs. (24 N•m).

Drill a 11/32 inch hole through the roof air deflector using the outermost hole in the antenna mount as a guide ( Figure 17). Install a 5/16" x 1-1/4" hex hd. bolt and 5/16 inch flat washer through this hole into the roof air deflector. Install a 5/16 inch flat washer and locknut on the bolt. Tighten to 18 ft-lbs. (24 N•m).

Drill two 11/32 inch holes through the side air deflector extender using the holes in the antenna mount that contact the air deflector extender as a guide ( Figure 17). Install 5/16" x 1-1/4" button hd. capscrews and 5/16 inch flat washers through the holes in the air deflector extender into the antenna mount. Install 5/16 inch flat washers and locknuts on the bolts. Tighten to 18 ft-lbs. (24 N•m).
Remove the 5th 5/16" bolt from the bottom that secures the air deflector extender to the roof air deflector ( Figure 18and Figure 19).

Secure the top of the brace to the bottom of the antenna mount in the hole provided with a 5/16"x 1-1/4" hex hd. bolt on a 72" and a 5/16" x 2" hex hd. bolt and a spacer on a 51", 2 flat washers and lock nut ( Figure 18 and Figure 19).

Install the bottom of the antenna mount brace to the air deflector extender in the hole where the bolt was removed, with the bolt removed in step 6 ( Figure 18). Tighten both bolts to 18 ft-lbs. (24 N•m).
Install antenna to the antenna mount per the antenna manufacturers instructions.
Run cable using "P" clamps or wire ties as required to insure that they do not vibrate, especially next to the antenna plugs.
Check antenna operation per manufacturer's instructions.
Hold the flexible cab trim molding in position against the rear edge of the air deflector extender assembly ( Figure 20).

Install No. 10 fasteners starting from the center and working out toward each end as illustrated in Figure 20. Snug up each fastener. Align the forward edge of the flexible molding flush with the outside trailing edge of the air deflector extender assembly.
Tighten all fasteners from the center out to 6 ft-lbs. (8 N•m). Do not over tighten as distortion of the flexible molding and retainer may result.

svcsubproc.title: Drilling Templates
svcsubproc.para: It will be necessary to create metal templates to use as a guide to drill the front bracket mounting holes in the air deflector (step 9 under LOW ROOF). One template can be made using the right side measurements. Reverse the right template to use it on the left side.

step1.para: Remove the 5/16"-18 torx hd. capscrews installed around the high roof ( Figure 21).
Carefully set the roof air deflector on the roof so that the holes in the air deflector line up with the holes in the roof ( Figure 22).

caution.para: Care should be taken not to mar the paint on the roof during air deflector installation.

step1.para: Reinstall the 5/16"-18 torx hd. capscrews that were removed in step 1 to secure the air deflector to the roof ( Figure 22). Tighten to 18 ft-lbs. (24 N•m).

Install the left and right flexible cab trim molding to the rear of both air deflector extenders. Position the flexible trim flush with the top of the air deflector extender. Secure the trim in position with one #10-16 x 1-1/4" self-drilling pan hd. screw in the center of the molding. Tighten the screws to 6 ft-lbs. (8 N•m). DO NOT OVER TIGHTEN.

Hold the air deflector extender in position against the back of the roof air deflector with "C" clamps. Position the extender so it is even with the top and flush with the outer edge of the roof air deflector.
Use the three holes in the extender as a template and drill 11/32" holes through the roof air deflector in these locations.

Secure the air deflector extender to the back of the roof air deflector with three 5/16"-18 x 1-1/4" bolts, 5/16" flat washers, special washers and lock nuts in the three drilled holes as illustrated in view B-B, Figure 23. Tighten the fasteners to 18 ft-lbs. (24 N•m). Repeat this procedure on the opposite side of the roof air deflector.

Install the roof fairing extender brace between the rear of the roof air deflector and the air deflector extender as illustrated in views A-A and C-C, Figure 23. Tighten fasteners to 18 ft-lbs. (24 N•m).

Install the side rear upper air deflector mounting brackets between the upper and lower side mounted air deflectors with 5/16"-18 x 1" SST hex hd. bolts and 5/16" lock washers as illustrated in view "D", Figure 23. Tighten all fasteners to 18 ft-lbs. (24 N•m).

At the lower end of the angle bracket on the air deflector extender is a hole. Make sure the lower end of the extender is flush with the outside of the roof air deflector and install a #10-16 x 1-1/4" self-drilling pan hd. screws in this hole, into the back of the fiberglass roof. Tighten to 6 ft-lbs. (8 N•m). DO NOT OVER TIGHTEN.
Repeat this procedure on the opposite side of the roof air deflector.
